info.title: ApiManagementClient
info.description: Use these REST APIs to manage Azure ApiManagement deployment and for performing operations on entities like API, Product, Subscription associated with the deployment.

post.description: Move resources from one resource group to another. The resources being moved should all be in the same resource group.

204.description: Successfully moved ApiManagement resources.

post.description: Manage deployments of an Api Management service. This operation can be used to  Change Sku or Sku Units, Change Service Tier (Developer/Standard/Premium) and Manage Vpn Configuration. This is a long running operation and could take several minutes to complete.

200.description: Successfully applied the new deployment Configuration on the ApiManagement service.

404.description: The service does not exist.

post.description: This operation restores a backup of an ApiManagement service created using ApiManagementService_Backup operation on current service. This is a long running operation and could take several minutes to complete.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Parameters supplied to the Restore Api Management service from backup operation.

200.description: Successfully restored the backup onto the ApiManagement service.

404.description: The service does not exist.

post.description: This operation creates a backup of the ApiManagement service to the given Azure Storage Account. This is long running operation and could take several minutes to complete.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Parameters supplied to the ApiManagementService_Backup operation.

200.description: Successfully backed up the ApiManagement service to the storage account.

404.description: The service does not exist.

put.description: Creates a new API Management service or updates an existing Api Management service. This is long running operation and could take several minutes to complete.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Parameters supplied to the CreateOrUpdate Api Management service operation.

200.description: The service was successfully Setup.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Parameters supplied to the CreateOrUpdate Api Management service operation.

200.description: Successfully updated the current ApiManagement service.

404.description: The service does not exist.

get.description: Get an Api Management service resource description.

200.description: Successfully got the ApiManagement Service Resource.

404.description: ApiManagement Service not found.

200.description: Service was successfully deleted.

204.description: Service is already deleted.

404.description: ApiManagement Service not found.

get.description: List all Api Management services within a resource group.

200.description: Return the Api Service List.

get.description: List all Api Management services within an Azure Subscription.

200.description: Return the Api Service List.

get.description: Gets the Single Sign On token for the API Management Service valid for 5 Minutes.

200.description: Returns 200 OK if successful with the SSO Redirect URI.

post.description: Checks availability and correctness of a name for an Api Management service.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Parameters supplied to the CheckNameAvailability operation.

200.description: Return the result of check name availability.

post.description: Upload Custom Domain SSL certificate for an Api Management service.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Parameters supplied to the Upload SSL certificate for an Api Management service operation.

200.description: Successfully uploaded certificate to the ApiManagement Service.

404.description: ApiManagement Service not found.

post.description: This operation creates, updates or deletes a custom hostname for an ApiManagement service. The custome hostname can be applied to Proxy and Portal endpoint. This is a long running operation and could take several minutes to complete.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Parameters supplied to the UpdateHostname operation.

200.description: Service was successfully updated with desired hostnames.

404.description: ApiManagement Service not found.

409.description: ApiManagement Service is currently being updated.

get.description: List all APIs of the Api Management service instance.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description:
| Field       | Supported operators    | Supported functions               |
|-------------|------------------------|-----------------------------------|
| id          | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, startswith, endswith |
| name        | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, startswith, endswith |
| description | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, startswith, endswith |
| serviceUrl  | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, startswith, endswith |
| path        | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, startswith, endswith |

200.description: Paged Result reponse of Apis.

get.description: This operation returns the details of the API specified by its identifier.

200.description: The response body contains the specified API entity.

404.description: The specified API does not exist.

put.description: Creates new or updates existing specific API of the Api Management service instance.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: ETag of the Api Entity. For Create Api Etag should not be specified. For Update Etag should match the existing Entity or it can be * for Unconditional Update.

409.description: API with same identified already exists.

patch.description: Patches specific API of the Api Management service instance.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: ETag of the Api Entity. Etag should match current Entity state or it should be * for Unconditional update.

204.description: The API was successfully imported.

404.description: The specified API does not exist.

delete.description: Deletes specific API of the Api Management service instance.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: ETag of the Api Entity. Etag should match current Entity state or it should be * for Unconditional update.

204.description: The API was successfully deleted.

412.description: Returned if the product resource doesn’t pass the condition specified by the If-Match header.

get.description: This operation returns a collection of the operations for the specified API.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description:
| Field       | Supported operators    | Supported functions               |
|-------------|------------------------|-----------------------------------|
| name        | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, startswith, endswith |
| method      | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, startswith, endswith |
| description | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, startswith, endswith |
| urlTemplate | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, startswith, endswith |

200.description: A collection of operation summary entities at the API level.

get.description: This operation returns the details of the API Operation specified by its identifier.

parameters.name: operationId
parameters.description: Identifier of the operation within the API.

200.description: The response body contains the specified Operation entity.

404.description: The specified operation does not exist.

put.description: Creates new API operation or updates an existing one.

404.description: The specified API does not exist.

409.description: Operation with same identified already exists.

patch.description: This operation updates the details of the operation specified by its identifier.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: ETag of the API Operation Entity. Etag should match current Entity state or it should be * for Unconditional update.

204.description: The operation was successfully updated.

404.description: The specified API or operation does not exist.

412.description: Returned if the operation resource doesn't pass the condition specified by the If-Match header.

delete.description: This operation deletes the specified operation.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: ETag of the API Operation Entity. Etag should match current Entity state or it should be * for Unconditional delete.

204.description: The operation was successfully deleted.

404.description: The specified API or operation does not exist.

412.description: Returned if the operation resource doesn't pass the condition specified by the If-Match header.

get.description: List all API associated products.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description:
| Field | Supported operators    | Supported functions                         |
|-------|------------------------|---------------------------------------------|
| name  | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith |

200.description: The operation returns a collection of products which have the Api entity.

404.description: The API does not exist.

get.description: List all subscriptions of the Api Management service instance.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description:
| Field        | Supported operators    | Supported functions                         |
|--------------|------------------------|---------------------------------------------|
| id           | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith |
| name         | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith |
| stateComment | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith |
| userId       | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith |
| productId    | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith |
| state        | eq                     |                                             |

200.description: A Collection of the Subscription entities for the specified API Management service instance.

get.description: The response body contains the specified Subscription entity.

200.description: The response body contains the specified Subscription entity.

404.description: The specified subscription does not exist.

put.description: This operation subscribes the specified user to the specified product.

201.description: The user was successfully subscribed to the product.

204.description: The user already subscribed to the product.

409.description: Subscription with the same identifier already exists.

patch.description: This operation updates the details of a subscription.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: ETag of the Subscription Entity. Etag should match current Entity state or it should be * for Unconditional update.

204.description: The subscription details were successfully updated.

404.description: The specified subscription doesn’t exist.

412.description: Returned if the resource doesn’t pass the condition specified by the If-Match header.

delete.description: Deletes specific subscription of the Api Management service instance.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: ETag of the Subscription Entity. Etag should match current Entity state or it should be * for Unconditional delete.

204.description: The subscription details were successfully deleted.

412.description: Returned if the resource doesn’t pass the condition specified by the If-Match header.

post.description: Regenerates primary key of existing subscription of the Api Management service instance.

204.description: The primary key was successfully regenerated.

404.description: The specified subscription does not exist.

409.description: The operation is not allowed due to the current subscription state.

post.description: Regenerates secondary key of existing subscription of the Api Management service instance.

204.description: The secondary key was successfully regenerated.

404.description: The specified subscription does not exist.

409.description: The operation is not allowed due to the current subscription state.

get.description: This operation returns a collection of products in the specified service instance.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description:
| Field       | Supported operators    | Supported functions                         |
|-------------|------------------------|---------------------------------------------|
| id          | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith |
| name        | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith |
| description | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith |
| terms       | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith |
| state       | eq                     |                                             |

parameters.name: expandGroups
parameters.description: When set to true, the response contains an array of groups that have visibility to the product. The default is false.

200.description: A Collection of the Product entities for the specified API Management service instance.

get.description: This operation returns the details of the product specified by its identifier.

200.description: The response body contains the specified Product entity.

404.description: The specified product does not exist.

put.description: This operation creates a new product.

204.description: Product already exists.

400.description: Request validation failed.One cause for request validation to fail is if either one or both of the approvalRequired and subscriptionLimit properties are present in the request body along with the subscriptionRequired property set to false.

409.description: Product with same identifier already exists.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: ETag of the Product Entity. Etag should match current Entity state or it should be * for Unconditional update.

204.description: No Content in case of Update Successfull.

400.description: Request validation failed.One cause for request validation to fail is if either one or both of the approvalRequired and subscriptionLimit properties are present in the request body along with the subscriptionRequired property set to false.

404.description: The specified product does not exist.

412.description: Returned if the product resource doesn’t pass the condition specified by the If-Match header.

parameters.name: deleteSubscriptions
parameters.description: Delete existing subscriptions to the product or not.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: ETag of the Product Entity. Etag should match current Entity state or it should be * for Unconditional delete.

204.description: The product was successfully deleted.

400.description: Request validation failed.One cause for request validation to fail is if either one or both of the approvalRequired and subscriptionLimit properties are present in the request body along with the subscriptionRequired property set to false.

412.description: Returned if the product resource doesn’t pass the condition specified by the If-Match header.

get.description: This operation lists the APIs associated with a product.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description:
| Field       | Supported operators    | Supported functions                         |
|-------------|------------------------|---------------------------------------------|
| id          | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith |
| name        | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith |
| description | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith |
| serviceUrl  | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith |
| path        | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith |

200.description: The response body contains a collection of Api entities in the product.

404.description: The specified product does not exist.

put.description: This operation adds an API to the specified product.

201.description: The API was successfully added to the product.

204.description: The specified API is already added to the product.

400.description: Request validation failed.This is typically caused by an invalid product or API id.

404.description: The specified product does not exist.

delete.description: This operation removes the specified API from the specified product.

204.description: The API was successfully removed from the product.

404.description: The specified product does not exist.

get.description: This operations returns the developer groups associated with the specified product.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description:
| Field       | Supported operators    | Supported functions                         |
|-------------|------------------------|---------------------------------------------|
| id          | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith |
| name        | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith |
| description | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith |
| type        | eq, ne                 | N/A                                         |

200.description: This operation returns a Collection of Group entities.

404.description: The specified product does not exist.

put.description: This operation associates the specified developer group with the specified product.

201.description: The group was successfully associated with the product..

204.description: The specified group is already associated with the product.

400.description: Request validation failed.This is typically caused by an invalid product or group id.

delete.description: This operation removes the association between the specified group and product.

204.description: The group was successfully disassociated with the product.

400.description: Request validation failed.This is typically caused by an invalid product or group id.

get.description: This operation returns a collection of groups defined within a service instance.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description:
| Field       | Supported operators    | Supported functions                         |
|-------------|------------------------|---------------------------------------------|
| id          | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith |
| name        | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith |
| description | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith |
| type        | eq, ne                 | N/A                                         |

200.description: This operation returns a Collection of Group entities.

get.description: This operation returns the details of the group specified by its identifier.

200.description: The response body contains the specified Group entity.

404.description: The specified group does not exist.

put.description: This operation creates a new group.

204.description: Group already exists.

409.description: The group with same identifier already exists.

patch.description: This operation updates the details of the group specified by its identifier.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: ETag of the Group Entity. Etag should match current Entity state or it should be * for Unconditional update.

204.description: The group details were successfully updated.

404.description: The specified group doesn’t exist.

405.description: The specified group cannot be updated because it is a built-in group.

412.description: Returned if the group resource doesn’t pass the condition specified by the If-Match header.

delete.description: Deletes specific group of the Api Management service instance.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: ETag of the Group Entity. Etag should match current Entity state or it should be * for Unconditional update.

204.description: The group was successfully deleted.

405.description: The specified group cannot be updated because it is a built-in group.

412.description: Returned if the group resource doesn’t pass the condition specified by the If-Match header.

get.description: This operation lists the members of the group, specified by its identifier.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description:
| Field            | Supported operators    | Supported functions               |
|------------------|------------------------|-----------------------------------|
| id               | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith |
| firstName        | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith |
| lastName         | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith |
| email            | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith |
| state            | eq                     | N/A                               |
| registrationDate | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | N/A                               |
| note             | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith |

200.description: This operation returns a Collection of user entities associated with the group.

404.description: The specified group does not exist.

put.description: This operation adds a user to a group.

201.description: The user was successfully added to the group.

204.description: The specified user is already a member of the specified group.

400.description: Request validation failed.This is typically caused by an invalid user identifier.

404.description: The specified group doesn’t exist.

405.description: Attempt was made to add a user to a built-in group. Built-in group membership is managed by the system.

delete.description: Remove existing user from existing group.

204.description: The user was successfully removed from the group..

400.description: Request validation failed.This is typically caused by an invalid user identifier.

404.description: The specified group doesn’t exist.

405.description: Attempt was made to add a user to a built-in group. Built-in group membership is managed by the system.

get.description: This operation returns a collection of all certificates in the specified service instance.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description:
| Field          | Supported operators    | Supported functions                         |
|----------------|------------------------|---------------------------------------------|
| id             | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith |
| subject        | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith |
| thumbprint     | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith |
| expirationDate | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | N/A                                         |

200.description: Returns a collection of Certificate entity.

get.description: This operation returns the details of the certificate specified by its identifier.

200.description: The response body contains the specified Certificate entity.

404.description: The specified certificate does not exist.

put.description: This operation adds a new certificate to or updates an existing certificate of the specified API Management service instance.

parameters.name: certificateId
parameters.description: Identifier of the certificate entity. Must be unique in the current API Management service instance.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: The entity state version of the Certificate. A value of "*" can be used for If-Match to unconditionally apply the operation..

201.description: The new certificate was successfully added.

409.description: Certificate with the same identifier already exists.

412.description: Returned if the resource doesn’t pass the condition specified by the If-Match header.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: The entity state version of the certificate. A value of "*" can be used for If-Match to unconditionally apply the operation.

204.description: The certificate was successfully deleted.

412.description: Returned if the resource doesn’t pass the condition specified by the If-Match header.

get.description: List all policy snippets.

200.description: Returns an array of Policy Contracts.

get.description: This operations returns the subscriptions to the specified product.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description:
| Field        | Supported operators    | Supported functions                         |
|--------------|------------------------|---------------------------------------------|
| id           | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith |
| name         | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith |
| stateComment | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith |
| userId       | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith |
| productId    | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith |
| state        | eq                     |                                             |

200.description: This operation returns a Collection of subscription entities.

404.description: The specified product does not exist.

get.description: This operation returns a collection of registered users in the specified service instance.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description:
| Field            | Supported operators    | Supported functions               |
|------------------|------------------------|-----------------------------------|
| id               | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith |
| firstName        | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith |
| lastName         | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith |
| email            | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith |
| state            | eq                     | N/A                               |
| registrationDate | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | N/A                               |
| note             | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith |

200.description: This operation returns a Collection of User entities.

get.description: This operation returns the details of the user specified by its identifier.

200.description: Gets the specified user entity.

404.description: The specified user does not exist.

put.description: This operation creates a new user.

409.description: User with the same identifier already exists.

patch.description: This operation updates the details of the user specified by its identifier.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: The entity state version of the user to update. A value of "*" can be used for If-Match to unconditionally apply the operation.

204.description: The user details were successfully updated.

404.description: The specified user doesn’t exist.

412.description: Returned if the user resource doesn’t pass the condition specified by the If-Match header.

parameters.name: deleteSubscriptions
parameters.description: Whether to delete user's subscription or not.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: The entity state version of the user to delete. A value of "*" can be used for If-Match to unconditionally apply the operation.

204.description: The user details were successfully deleted.

412.description: Returned if the user resource doesn’t pass the condition specified by the If-Match header.

post.description: This operation retrieves a redirection URL containing an authentication token for signing a given user into the developer portal.

200.description: The response body contains the single sign-on URL.

404.description: The specified user does not exist.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description:

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description:
| Field        | Supported operators    | Supported functions                         |
|--------------|------------------------|---------------------------------------------|
| id           | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith |
| name         | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith |
| stateComment | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith |

| productId    | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith |
| state        | eq                     |                                             |

200.description: This operation returns a Collection of Subscription entities.

404.description: The specified user does not exist.

get.description: This operation returns a collection of authorization servers defined within a service instance.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description:
| Field | Supported operators    | Supported functions                         |
|-------|------------------------|---------------------------------------------|
| id    | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith |
| name  | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith |

200.description: A Collection of the Authorization Server entities for the specified API Management service instance.

get.description: This operation returns the details of the authorization server specified by its identifier.

204.description: The authorization server settings were successfully updated.

412.description: Returned if the resource doesn’t pass the condition specified by the If-Match header.

204.description: Authorization server is already registered.

409.description: Authorization server with the same identifier already exists.

patch.description: This operation updates the details of the authorization server specified by its identifier.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: The entity state version of the authorization server to update. A value of "*" can be used for If-Match to unconditionally apply the operation.

204.description: The authorization server settings were successfully updated.

412.description: Returned if the resource doesn’t pass the condition specified by the If-Match header.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: The entity state version of the authentication server to update. A value of "*" can be used for If-Match to unconditionally apply the operation.

204.description: The authorization server settings were successfully deleted.

404.description: The specified authorization server does not exist.

412.description: Returned if the resource doesn’t pass the condition specified by the If-Match header.

get.description: List all azure regions in which the service exists.

200.description: List of Regions in which the service is deployed.

get.description: List all user identities.

200.description: List of User Identities.

404.description: The specified user does not exist.

get.description: Lists report records.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: The filter to apply on the operation.

parameters.name: interval
parameters.description: By time interval. This value is only applicable to ByTime aggregation. Interval must be multiple of 15 minutes and may not be zero. The value should be in ISO  8601 format (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Durations).This code can be used to convert TimSpan to a valid interval string: XmlConvert.ToString(new TimeSpan(hours, minutes, secconds))

200.description: This operation returns a Collection of Report record.

get.description: Get tenant access information details.

200.description: Tenant Access information.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: The entity state version of the tenant access settings to update. A value of "*" can be used for If-Match to unconditionally apply the operation.

409.description: Entity with the same identifier already exists.

412.description: Returned if the resource doesn’t pass the condition specified by the If-Match header.

204.description: The primary key was successfully regenerated.
The secondary key was successfully regenerated.

get.description: This operation returns a collection of loggers in the specified service instance.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description:
| Field | Supported operators    | Supported functions                         |
|-------|------------------------|---------------------------------------------|
| id    | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith |
| type  | eq                     |                                             |

200.description: This operation returns a collection of Logger entities.

get.description: This operation returns the details of the logger specified by its identifier.

200.description: The response body contains the specified Logger entity.

404.description: The specified logger does not exist.

put.description: This operation creates a new logger or updates and existing one.

204.description: The existing logger was successfully updated.

409.description: Logger with the same identifier already exists.

patch.description: This operation updates an existing logger.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: The entity state version of the logger to update. A value of "*" can be used for If-Match to unconditionally apply the operation.

204.description: The existing logger was successfully updated.

404.description: The specified logger does not exist.

412.description: Returned if the logger resource doesn’t pass the condition specified by the If-Match header.

delete.description: This operation deletes the specified logger.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: The entity state version of the logger to delete. A value of "*" can be used for If-Match to unconditionally apply the operation.

204.description: The logger was successfully deleted.

400.description: The logger cannot be deleted because it is being used by one or more policies.

412.description: Returned if the logger resource doesn’t pass the condition specified by the If-Match header.

get.description: This operation returns a collection of properties defined within a service instance.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description:
| Field | Supported operators    | Supported functions                                   |
|-------|------------------------|-------------------------------------------------------|
| tags  | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith, any, all |
| name  | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith           |

200.description: A Collection of the Property entities for the specified API Management service instance.

get.description: This operation returns the details of the property specified by its identifier.

200.description: The response body contains the specified Property entity.

404.description: The specified property does not exist.

204.description: Property was successfully updated.

409.description: Property with the specified identifier already exists.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: The entity state version of the property to update. A value of "*" can be used for If-Match to unconditionally apply the operation.

204.description: Property was successfully updated.

404.description: Property with the specified identifier does not exists.

412.description: Returned if the property resource doesn’t pass the condition specified by the If-Match header.

delete.description: Deletes specific property from the the Api Management service instance.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: The entity state version of the property to delete. A value of "*" can be used for If-Match to unconditionally apply the operation.

204.description: Property was successfully deleted.

405.description: The specified property cannot be deleted because it is in use in a policy. You must remove all references to this property before it can be deleted.

412.description: Returned if the property resource doesn’t pass the condition specified by the If-Match header.

get.description: This operation returns the Git access configuration for the tenant.

post.description: Regenerate primary access key for GIT.

204.description: The primary key was successfully regenerated.

post.description: Regenerate secondary access key for GIT.

204.description: The secondary key was successfully regenerated.

post.description: This operation applies changes from the specified Git branch to the configuration database. This is a long running operation and could take several minutes to complete.

200.description: Result of appplying changes from Git branch to database.

post.description: This operation creates a commit with the current configuration snapshot to the specified branch in the repository. This is a long running operation and could take several minutes to complete.

200.description: Result of creating a commit in the repository.

post.description: This operation validates the changes in the specified Git branch. This is a long running operation and could take several minutes to complete.

200.description: Result of validating the changes in the specified Git branch.

get.description: This operation returns the status of the most recent synchronization between the configuration database and the Git repository.

200.description: Sync state result.

required.description: whether parameter is required or not.

queryParameters.description: Collection of operation request query parameters.

urlTemplate.description: Operation URI template. Cannot be more than 400 characters long.

OperationCreateOrUpdateParameters.description: Parameters supplied to the CreateOrUpdate Operation operation.

description.description: Product description. May be 1 to 500 characters long.

terms.description: Product terms and conditions. Developer will have to accept these terms before he's allowed to call product API.

subscriptionRequired.description: Whether a product subscription is required for accessing APIs included in this product. If true, the product is referred to as "protected" and a valid subscription key is required for a request to an API included in the product to succeed. If false, the product is referred to as "open" and requests to an API included in the product can be made without a subscription key. If property is omitted when creating a new product it's value is assumed to be true.

approvalRequired.description: whether subscription approval is required. If false, new subscriptions will be approved automatically enabling developers to call the product’s APIs immediately after subscribing. If true, administrators must manually approve the subscription before the developer can any of the product’s APIs. Can be present only if subscriptionRequired property is present and has a value of false.

subscriptionsLimit.description: whether the number of subscriptions a user can have to this product at the same time. Set to null or omit to allow unlimited per user subscriptions. Can be present only if subscriptionRequired property is present and has a value of false.

state.description: whether product is published or not. Published products are discoverable by users of developer portal. Non published products are visible only to administrators.

createdDate.description: Subscription creation date. The date conforms to the following format: `yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ` as specified by the ISO 8601 standard.

startDate.description: Subscription activation date. The date conforms to the following format: `yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ` as specified by the ISO 8601 standard.

expirationDate.description: Subscription expiration date. The date conforms to the following format: `yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ` as specified by the ISO 8601 standard.

endDate.description: Date when subscription was cancelled or expired. The date conforms to the following format: `yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ` as specified by the ISO 8601 standard.

notificationDate.description: Upcoming subscription expiration notification date. The date conforms to the following format: `yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ` as specified by the ISO 8601 standard.

userId.description: User (user id path) for whom subscription is being created in form /users/{uid}

productId.description: Product (product id path) for which subscription is being created in form /products/{productid}

primaryKey.description: Primary subscription key. If not specified during request key will be generated automatically.

secondaryKey.description: Secondary subscription key. If not specified during request key will be generated automatically.
